Context:
* The Winter 2024 semester for the Con Ed ESL Part-Time program runs from January 16 to April 22, 2024.
* ESL compulsory courses will be offered in hybrid delivery mode.
* All ESL elective courses will be offered online only and require students to attend scheduled synchronous online classes using platforms like Zoom or Microsoft Teams.
* Students need a computer with a reliable Internet connection, camera, and good speakers or headphones for online classes.
* In-person ESL elective classes will not be recorded and must be attended at a scheduled time on campus (341 King St E).
* To apply to the program, students can take an English placement test or submit IELTS (Academic) or TOEFL test results taken within the last six months.
* The certificate program is for improving personal, professional, and academic English language skills, developing professional communication skills, and meeting English Language admission requirements for George Brown Certificate, Diploma, or Postgraduate Certificate programs without co-op.
* Students must achieve a cumulative grade average of B (73%) or better in all courses to complete the certificate.

Context:
* George Brown College ESL students who have completed a course within the last six months can apply to the next level without taking a placement test.
* Online registration for returning students and new students takes place for the Winter 2024 Semester (January 16 - April 22, 2024).
* IELTS exam preparation courses are designed for intermediate to advanced level ESL students planning to take the IELTS exam and aiming to achieve a desired score.
* These courses focus on listening, speaking, reading, and writing strategies related to the exam.
* The course is for ESL students applying for a working visa, permanent residence in Canada, or Canadian citizenship and require proof of English language proficiency as part of their application.
* Visit the Continuing Education website to learn more about the IELTS exam preparation courses and other offerings.
* International Learners can also visit the Continuing Education website for policies and information specific to them.
* To receive updates on application deadlines, college news, events, tours and more, sign up now.
* Contact George Brown College at 416-415-2000 or TTY: 1-877-515-5559, or email ask.george@georgebrown.ca for inquiries.
* Visit the Social Media Hub for more information and updates.
* The information on the website is subject to change without notice and should not be considered a representation, offer, or warranty. Students are responsible for verifying George Brown College fee requirements.
